Main0_setup - main control register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_9000
Physical Address = 32'h0000_9000
Verilog CL45 Address = {`Main0_A, `setup_Adr}
Verilog CL22 Address = {`Main0_A, 4'h0}, `setup_A
Reset Value = 16'h0080
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:10 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
09:07 RW refclk_sel THE VERSION OF THIS FIELD USED BY THE LOGIC RESIDES IN MPP0 ONLY.
THE VERSION OF THIS FIELD IN MPP1 HAS NO EFFECT ON THE LOGIC.
Specifies refclk frequency for tick generation only.
0,3,4,5,6,7 = N/A
1 = clk_156p25MHz
2 = clk_312p5Mhz
Reset value is clk_156p25MHz.
06:04 RW port_mode_sel port configuration selects
TRI_1_PORT - lanes 2,3 aggregated and 0,1 as 3 ports
TRI_2_PORT - lanes 1,0 aggregated and 3,2 as 3 ports
0x0 = QUAD_PORT
0x1 = TRI_1_PORT
0x2 = TRI_2_PORT
0x3 = DUAL_PORT
0x4 = SINGLE_PORT
0x5 = SINGLE_OCTAL_PORT
Reset value is QUAD_PORT.
03 RW resolved_port_mode_control Determines how the resolved_port_mode is formulated:
0: Based on the port_mode_sel, and the num_lanes
1: Based on the port_mode_sel only
Reset value is 0.
02:00 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.

Return to Main0: Main0 Registers Table

Fields marked _mpp will use per-MPP register, else the copy resides only in MPP0
Reset value is 1.

When this bit is 0, ECC 2bit uncorrectable error on tx_1588_400g SRF instance will NOT affect PCS output u0_pcs_ecc_error_interrupt

PktGen1_GlasTest_Control - GLAS Test Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_9045
Physical Address = 32'h0000_9045
Verilog CL45 Address = {`PktGen1_A, `GlasTest_Control_Adr}
Verilog CL22 Address = {`PktGen1_A, 4'h0}, `GlasTest_Control_A
Reset Value = 16'h007c
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:07 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
06:02 RW GlasTest_ID GLAS instance selector for Expected and Actual. 0..7=RX_TS. 8=TX_TS. 9..16=TX_PMA
If GlasTest_ID values of 17-31 are selected the GlasTest_exp and
GlasTest_ActData register reads will always provide zeroes
S/W is expected to write a value of 31, whenever the GlasTest mode operation is complete.
Reset value is 31.
01 SC GlasTest_OneShot When SW writes a 1 to this bit, HW will issue OneShot test for all GLAS instances.
Self-clearing after 32 tsc_clk periods.
"This should be enabled only when normal traffic is not ON".
Reset value is 0.
00 RW GlasTest_en 1=Enable Test Mode for all GLAS instances. 0=Enable Functional Mode for all GLAS instances.
When this bit is set to 1, 1588 timestamping function is not supported.
Reset value is 0.

09 RW glas_tpma_capture_logical If this bit is set to 1, the glas tpma capture will store logical lane values in indices 0 to 7

00 RW glas_tpma_capture_en Enable capturing data,adj values from tpma glas instances as defined by the mask
Rising edge required to trigger capture. SW must write 1 to trigger capture, then write 0 to end capture.
Reset value is 0x0.

RX_X1_Control0_RS_FEC_config - RS_FEC configuration register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_9223
Physical Address = 32'h0000_9223
Verilog CL45 Address = {`RX_X1_Control0_A, `RS_FEC_config_Adr}
Verilog CL22 Address = {`RX_X1_Control0_A, 4'h0}, `RS_FEC_config_A
Reset Value = 16'h0002
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RW RS_FEC_CORRECTION_ENABLE 1'b0 - FEC performs detection only.  This is the minimum latency mode.
1'b1 - FEC performs detection and correction.  This is the max latency mode.
Reset value is 0x1.
00 RW RS_FEC_CW_TYPE 1'b0 - Both RS 528 and RS 544 frames are supported.  Latency supports RS 544 frames
1'b1 - Only RS 528 or RS 272 Frames are supported.  Reduces latency slightly.
Reset value is 0x0.

Same as the pmd_x4_status register field.
07:06 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
05 CR rx_clk_vld_LH rx_clk_vld indication from PMD posedge detected
04 CR rx_clk_vld_LL rx_clk_vld indication from PMD negedge detected
03 CR signal_detect_LH Signal Detect indication from PMD posedge detected
02 CR signal_detect_LL Signal Detect indication from PMD negedge detected
01 CR rx_lock_LH DSC RX lock indication from PMD posedge detected
00 CR rx_lock_LL DSC RX lock indication from PMD negedge detected

Return to pmd_x4: PMD per lane Control & Status Table

Address Offset = 32'h0000_c015

Reset Value = 16'h0000

Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW ui_frac_m1_to_m16 PMD lane bit-time in fractional nanoseconds, upper bits

TX_X4_Control0_misc - Misc register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_c111
Physical Address = 32'h0000_c111
Verilog CL45 Address = {`TX_X4_Control0_A, `misc_Adr}
Verilog CL22 Address = {`TX_X4_Control0_A, 4'h0}, `misc_A
Reset Value = 16'h001c
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:05 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
04 RW tx_li_enable If this bit is a one, LIs (Link Interrupt) are passed thru to the RS LAYER.
If this bit is a zero, LIs (Link Interrupt) are replaced by IDLEs which are then passed
to the RS LAYER.
Reset value is 1.
03 RW tx_lf_enable If this bit is a one, LFs are passed from the RS LAYER to the PCS.
If this bit is a zero, LFs are replaced by IDLEs which are then passed
to the PCS.
Reset value is 1.
02 RW tx_rf_enable If this bit is a one, RFs are passed from the RS LAYER to the PCS.
If this bit is a zero, RFs are replaced by IDLEs which are then passed
to the PCS.
Reset value is 1.
01 RW rstb_tx_lane Low active reset for txp lanes
00 RW enable_tx_lane Per lane enable to allow DVs from MAC to enter TXP

TX_X4_Control0_tx_ts_control - TX TimeStamping Control register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_c112
Physical Address = 32'h0000_c112
Verilog CL45 Address = {`TX_X4_Control0_A, `tx_ts_control_Adr}
Verilog CL22 Address = {`TX_X4_Control0_A, 4'h0}, `tx_ts_control_A
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:03 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
02 RW tsts_interrupt_en 1588 Two Step Time Stamping Interrupt enable.
A value of one (1'b1) enables the interrupt.
A value of zero (1'b0) clears the interrupt.
Reset value is 0.
01 RW xgmii_sfd_time_stamp_enable This bit must be set to 1 if the RS Layer is XGMII, and SFD based timestamping is required.
Otherwise, this bit must be set to 0.
Reset value is 0.
00 RW OSTS_Pipeline_Enable Enables the 1588 One Step Processing Pipeline for this port.
Reset value is 0.

Return to TX_X4_Control0: TX X4 Control 0 Registers Table

TX_X4_Control0_error_control - TX Error injection Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_c113
Physical Address = 32'h0000_c113
Verilog CL45 Address = {`TX_X4_Control0_A, `error_control_Adr}
Verilog CL22 Address = {`TX_X4_Control0_A, 4'h0}, `error_control_A
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:12 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
11:04 RW rs_fec_lane_error_inject One bit per 80 bit lane of RS FEC output to cause a single error to be injected.
In 1XN mode, only bits 7:4 apply.
In 2XN mode, bits 11:4 apply.
The error is controlled by the following per MPP registers.
{
PktGen1_ErrorMask4,
PktGen1_ErrorMask3,
PktGen1_ErrorMask2,
PktGen1_ErrorMask1,
PktGen1_ErrorMask0 Error mask bits 15:0
}
The same mask is applied to all lanes that are enabled for a single error injection
03:00 RW pcs_lane_error_inject One bit per PCS lane to cause a single error to be injected.
A rising edge on each bits results in an error injection on the next DV for that lane.
The error is controlled by the following per MPP registers.
{
PktGen1_ErrorMask4[1:0] ,
PktGen1_ErrorMask3,
PktGen1_ErrorMask2,
PktGen1_ErrorMask1,
PktGen1_ErrorMask0 Error mask bits 15:0
"}
The same mask is applied to all lanes that are enabled for a single error injection
NOTE:
All of the bits (3:0) can all apply for Port 0.
Only bit 1 can apply for Port 1
Only bits 2:3 can all apply for Port 2
Only bit 3 can apply for Port 3.

Return to TX_X4_Control0: TX X4 Control 0 Registers Table

RX_X4_Control0_RS_FEC_rx_control_0 - RS_FEC control register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_c131
Physical Address = 32'h0000_c131
Verilog CL45 Address = {`RX_X4_Control0_A, `RS_FEC_rx_control_0_Adr}
Verilog CL22 Address = {`RX_X4_Control0_A, 4'h0}, `RS_FEC_rx_control_0_A
Reset Value = 16'h8000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW CW_BAD_ENABLE This bit enables the RS FEC to indicate CW_bad, if the CW is not corrected.
In Detect only mode, CWs are never corrected, so all CWs with errors will have CW_bad asserted, if CW_BAD_ENABLE == 1.
In Detect and Correct mode, only CWs that can not be corrected by the FEC will have CW_bad asserted if CW_BAD_ENABLE == 1.
Reset value is 0x1.
14:00 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.

Return to RX_X4_Control0: RX X4 Control 0 Registers Table

RX_X4_Control0_decode_control_0 - Decoder control 0 register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_c132
Physical Address = 32'h0000_c132
Verilog CL45 Address = {`RX_X4_Control0_A, `decode_control_0_Adr}
Verilog CL22 Address = {`RX_X4_Control0_A, 4'h0}, `decode_control_0_A
Reset Value = 16'h000e
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:05 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
04 RW r_test_mode_cfg   Test Mode enable for both CL49 and CL82
03 RW rx_li_enable If this bit is a one, LIs (Link Interrupt) are passed thru to the PCS.
If this bit is a zero, LIs (Link Interrupt) are replaced by IDLEs which are then passed
to the PCS.
Reset value is 1.
02 RW rx_lf_enable If this bit is a one, LFs are passed to the RS layer from the PCS.
If this bit is a zero, LFs are replaced by IDLEs which are then passed
to the RS layer.
Reset value is 1.
01 RW rx_rf_enable If this bit is a one, RFs are passed to the RS layer from the PCS.
If this bit is a zero, RFs are replaced by IDLEs which are then passed
to the RS layer.
Reset value is 1.
00 RW LPI_ENABLE If off (0), LPIs are converted to IDLEs.

13:08 CR cl49_ber_count For cl49 - This field is the 6 bit BER count.
It is used to count the number of times BER_BAD_SH state is entered.
The counter saturates at 6'h3F and clears on read.
07:00 CR ieee_errored_blocks Contains the count of the errored blocks decoded by the cl49/cl82 decoders.
For cl82, it contains the lower 8 bits of the 22 bit value. The upper 14 bits are present in the cl82_errored_blocks_ho register.

AN_X4_ABILITIES_cl73_cfg - CL73 Auto Neg Config Reg
Address Offset = 32'h0000_c1c0
Physical Address = 32'h0000_c1c0
Verilog CL45 Address = {`AN_X4_ABILITIES_A, `cl73_cfg_Adr}
Verilog CL22 Address = {`AN_X4_ABILITIES_A, 4'h0}, `cl73_cfg_A
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:14 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
13 RW disable_remote_fault Disable the Remote Fault Reporting
Reset value is 0.
12:11 RW num_advertised_lanes Defines the number of lanes that are available via the advertised pages
SW must set this field before enabling AN
0: one lane
1: two lanes
2: four lanes
3: eight lanes
Reset value is 0.
10 RW cl73_bam_enable Broadcom CL73 Auto-Negotiation Mode Enable
Reset value is 0.
09 RW MSA_Fec_Mapping Controls mapping of CL91_REQ_EN and CL74_REQ_EN bits onto the UP-1 page.
The 25G/50G MSA places these fields in bits 42 (CL91_REQ_EN) and 43 (CL74_REQ_EN).
The BAM mode places these fields in bits 43 (CL91_REQ_EN) and 44 (CL74_REQ_EN).
When this bit is a one (1'b1), the MSA bit positions are used.
When this bit is a zero (1'b0), the BAM bit positions are used.
Reset value is 0.
08 RW cl73_enable IEEE CL73 Auto-Negotiation Mode Enable
Reset value is 0.
07 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
06 RW cl73_nonce_match_over Clause 73 nonce match over-ride
05 RW cl73_nonce_match_val Clause 73 nonce match value
04:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW cl73_an_restart CL73 Auto-Negotiation Restart
A transition from zero to one on this bit will restart CL73 AN
Reset value is 0.

ilkn_x4_control0: ilkn Control Registers

Offset (Bytes)Register Name Description
0xc330ilkn_x4_control0_ilkn_control0ilkn control 0 register

Return to TSC Table

ilkn_x4_control0_ilkn_control0 - ilkn control 0 register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_c330
Physical Address = 32'h0000_c330
Verilog CL45 Address = {`ilkn_x4_control0_A, `ilkn_control0_Adr}
Verilog CL22 Address = {`ilkn_x4_control0_A, 4'h0}, `ilkn_control0_A
Reset Value = 16'h0004
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW credit_en 1 = enable credit generation to bypass interface on the egress path
When 0, no credit is issued for the egress path of the bypass interface
Reset value is 0.
14:10 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
09 RW soft_rst_rx 1 = reset rx path logic, other register setting is not changed; set bit to 0 for normal operation
Reset value is 0.
08 RW soft_rst_tx 1 = reset tx path logic, other register setting is not changed; set bit to 0 for normal operation
Reset value is 0.
07:05 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
04 RW ilkn_sel 1 = enable ingress and egress data paths through ilkn bypass logic
When 0, data paths are connected to the PCS interface
Reset value is 0.
03:00 RW wm Watermark to reach before data from bypass interface is sent on egress data path
Watermark applies to the egress path only
The optimal setting of the watermark is between 2 and 6
Watermark level of 2 is set for any configuration value of less than 2
Watermark level of 6 is set for any configuration value of greater than 6
Reset value is 4.

Return to ilkn_x4_control0: ilkn Control Registers Table
